title: Google\Cloud\BigQuery\DataTransfer\V1\CreateTransferConfigRequest
name: CreateTransferConfigRequest
description:
A request to create a data transfer configuration. If new credentials are needed for this transfer configuration, an authorization code must be provided. If an authorization code is provided, the transfer configuration will be associated with the user id corresponding to the authorization code.

Otherwise, the transfer configuration will be associated with the calling user.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.bigquery.datatransfer.v1.CreateTransferConfigRequest

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.parent
params.description: Required. The BigQuery project id where the transfer configuration should be created. Must be in the format projects/{project_id}/locations/{location_id} or projects/{project_id}. If specified location and location of the destination bigquery dataset do not match - the request will fail.

params.name: data.authorization_code
params.description: Optional OAuth2 authorization code to use with this transfer configuration. This is required if new credentials are needed, as indicated by CheckValidCreds. In order to obtain authorization_code, please make a request to https://www.gstatic.com/bigquerydatatransfer/oauthz/auth?client_id=&scope=&redirect_uri= client_id should be OAuth client_id of BigQuery DTS API for the given data source returned by ListDataSources method. data_source_scopes are the scopes returned by ListDataSources method. * redirect_uri is an optional parameter. If not specified, then authorization code is posted to the opener of authorization flow window. Otherwise it will be sent to the redirect uri. A special value of urn:ietf:wg:oauth:2.0:oob means that authorization code should be returned in the title bar of the browser, with the page text prompting the user to copy the code and paste it in the application.

params.name: data.version_info
params.description: Optional version info. If users want to find a very recent access token, that is, immediately after approving access, users have to set the version_info claim in the token request. To obtain the version_info, users must use the "none+gsession" response type. which be return a version_info back in the authorization response which be be put in a JWT claim in the token request.

params.name: data.service_account_name
params.description: Optional service account name. If this field is set, transfer config will be created with this service account credentials. It requires that requesting user calling this API has permissions to act as this service account.

methods.name: setTransferConfig
methods.description:
Required. Data transfer configuration to create.

Generated from protobuf field .google.cloud.bigquery.datatransfer.v1.TransferConfig transfer_config = 2 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = REQUIRED];

methods.name: getAuthorizationCode
methods.description:
Optional OAuth2 authorization code to use with this transfer configuration.

This is required if new credentials are needed, as indicated by CheckValidCreds. In order to obtain authorization_code, please make a request to https://www.gstatic.com/bigquerydatatransfer/oauthz/auth?client_id=&scope=&redirect_uri=

  • client_id should be OAuth client_id of BigQuery DTS API for the given data source returned by ListDataSources method.
  • data_source_scopes are the scopes returned by ListDataSources method.
  • redirect_uri is an optional parameter. If not specified, then authorization code is posted to the opener of authorization flow window. Otherwise it will be sent to the redirect uri. A special value of urn:ietf:wg:oauth:2.0:oob means that authorization code should be returned in the title bar of the browser, with the page text prompting the user to copy the code and paste it in the application.

Generated from protobuf field string authorization_code = 3;

  • client_id should be OAuth client_id of BigQuery DTS API for the given data source returned by ListDataSources method.
  • data_source_scopes are the scopes returned by ListDataSources method.
  • redirect_uri is an optional parameter. If not specified, then authorization code is posted to the opener of authorization flow window. Otherwise it will be sent to the redirect uri. A special value of urn:ietf:wg:oauth:2.0:oob means that authorization code should be returned in the title bar of the browser, with the page text prompting the user to copy the code and paste it in the application.

methods.name: getVersionInfo
methods.description:
Optional version info. If users want to find a very recent access token, that is, immediately after approving access, users have to set the version_info claim in the token request. To obtain the version_info, users must use the "none+gsession" response type. which be return a version_info back in the authorization response which be be put in a JWT claim in the token request.

Generated from protobuf field string version_info = 5;
